FuncDef:
The server ipv6 address command sets the IPv6 address for an AS control server (ACS).
The undo server ipv6 address command deletes the IPv6 address of an ACS.
No IPv6 address of an ACS is configured on an AER by default.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the IPv6 address of an ACS.
The value is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

ExtraInfo:
An ACS, functioning as an agent of a local AS in a trust alliance, communicates with the registration center (REG) and other ASs in the trust alliance and sends configurations to AERs in the local AS. Each member in a trust alliance has only one ACS.
After entering the SMA view using the sma command, run the server ipv6 address command to set an IPv6 address of an ACS. An ACS communicates with AERs in the same AS so that the ACS can send the trust alliance member list, IPv6 address prefixes, and tag information to the AERs. The ACS and AERs exchange SMA protocol packets to deploy functions, query information, and respond to requests.
